required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial of Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine in Children Aged 3-8 Years Old
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Immunogenicity and Safety of One vs Two Doses of Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine in Children Aged 3-8 Years Old

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, randomized and controlled phase Ⅳ clinical trial of quadrivalent influenza vaccine manufactured by Sinovac Biotech Co. , the purpose of this study is to compare the immunogenicity and safety after 1 dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine with that of 2 doses in vaccine-unprimed children aged 3-8 years old,to compare the immunogenicity and safety after 1 dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine in vaccine-unprimed children aged 3-8 years old with that of 1 dose in vaccine-primed children and to compare the immunogenicity and safety after 2 doses of quadrivalent influenza vaccine in vaccine-unprimed children aged 3-8 years old with that of 1 dose in vaccine-primed children.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is open-label, randomized and controlled phase Ⅳ clinical trial of quadrivalent influenza vaccine.The purpose of this study is to compare the immunogenicity and safety after 1 dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine with that of 2 doses in vaccine-unprimed children aged 3-8 years old,to compare the immunogenicity and safety after 1 dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine in vaccine-unprimed children aged 3-8 years old with that of 1 dose in vaccine-primed children and to compare the immunogenicity and safety after 2 doses of quadrivalent influenza vaccine in vaccine-unprimed children aged 3-8 years old with that of 1 dose in vaccine-primed children.A total of 600 subjects including 400 vaccine-unprimed children and 200 vaccine-primed children will be enrolled,400 vaccine-unprimed children will be randomly divided into two groups in a 1:1 ratio.Subjects in group 1(experimental group 1 ) will receive two doses of quadrivalent influenza vaccine on the immunization schedule of day 0,28 and subjects in group 2 (experimental group 2) will receive one dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine.200 vaccine-primed children (experimental group 3) will receive one dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine.

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity index of the seroconversion rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the vaccination of the last dose
primary_outcome.description: The seroconversion rate of each influenza strain after each dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity index of the seroprotective rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the vaccination of the last dose
primary_outcome.description: The seroprotective rate of each influenza strain after each dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the vaccination of the last dose
primary_outcome.description: The GMT of each influenza strain after each dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the vaccination of the last dose
primary_outcome.description: The GMI of each influenza strain after each dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine

primary_outcome.measure: Safety index of the incidence of adverse reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day 0 to day 7 after each dose vaccination
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of adverse reactions within 0-7 days after each dose

primary_outcome.measure: Safety index of the incidence of adverse reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day 0 to day 28 after each dose vaccination
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of adverse reactions within 0-28 days after each dose

primary_outcome.measure: Safety index of the incidence of serious adverse events(SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of the vaccination to 28 days after the whole-schedule vaccination
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of serious adverse events from the beginning of vaccination to 28 days after the last dose

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental Group ：Vaccine-unprimed subjects with two doses
arm_group.description: 200 vaccine-unprimed children will receive two doses of quadrivalent influenza vaccine on the immunization schedule of day 0,28.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental Group ：Vaccine-unprimed subjects with one dose
arm_group.description: 200 vaccine-unprimed children will receive one dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental Group：Vaccine-primed subjects with one dose
arm_group.description: 200 vaccine-primed children will receive one dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine.

intervention.intervention_name: Two doses of quadrivalent influenza vaccine
intervention.description: 15ug hemagglutinin (HA) of each of the four influenza strains in 0.5 mL of sodium chloride, disodium hydrogen phosphate, sodium dihydrogen phosphate per injection.The routine of administation is Intramuscular injection into deltoid region.And the immunization schedule is two doses of quadrivalent influenza vaccine on day 0, 28.
intervention.arm_group_label: Experimental Group ：Vaccine-unprimed subjects with two doses

intervention.intervention_name: One dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine
intervention.description: 15ug hemagglutinin (HA) of each of the four influenza strains in 0.5 mL of sodium chloride, disodium hydrogen phosphate, sodium dihydrogen phosphate per injection.The routine of administation is Intramuscular injection into deltoid region.And the immunization schedule is one dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine on day 0.
intervention.arm_group_label: Experimental Group ：Vaccine-unprimed subjects with one dose
Experimental Group：Vaccine-primed subjects with one dose

overall_official.affiliation: Jiangsu Provincial Center for Disease Prevention and Control

facility.name: Suining Center for Disease Control and Prevention
